metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000250 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
All versions of the SDP server in BlueZ 5.46 and earlier are vulnerable toan information disclosure vulnerability which allows remote attackers toobtain sensitive information from the bluetoothd process memory. Thisvulnerability lies in the processing of SDP search attribute requests.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000250` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bluetooth - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-cups - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-hcidump - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-obexd - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
bluez-tests - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
libbluetooth3 - 5.37-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bluez package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.37-0ubuntu5.1').
